intro: Echites hirtiflorus, commonly known as the hairy-flowered echites, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with toxic properties. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough texture. Echites hirtiflorus is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its drought-resistant features.
